intro: Cordylanthus compactus, commonly known as the dwarf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a low-growing perennial herb that produces small, showy yellow flowers in the spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Cordylanthus compactus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in dry, coastal environments.
